summary: SA/DO/O is the recipient of multiple memoranda from H. Clark Schor in January 1978. These memoranda provide additional information in response to a request from the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) regarding individuals and entities of interest. The documents detail the types and quantity of documents held by the Central Cover Staff (CCS) on each. The memos reference files on George DeMohrenschildt, Leo Cherne, William Harvey, the International Rescue Committee, Richard Helms, James Angleton, Raymond Rocca, and the Wackenhut Corporation.
significance: SA/DO/O's significance lies in its role as a recipient of information related to the HSCA's investigation into the JFK assassination. The documents suggest that SA/DO/O was involved in gathering and disseminating information from the Central Cover Staff (CCS) to the HSCA, concerning individuals and entities potentially relevant to the assassination.
